text.__SUMMARY__: Conus pusio is a species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Conidae, the cone snails and their allies.Like all species within the genus Conus, these snails are predatory and venomous. They are capable of "stinging" humans, therefore live ones should be handled carefully or not at all.
text.Distribution: This marine species occurs off the Dominican Republic; in the Caribbean off Guadeloupe; Martinique; off Brazil; in the Mid-Atlantic Ridge.
text.Description: The maximum recorded shell length is 24.5 mm.
text.Habitat: Minimum recorded depth is 0 m. Maximum recorded depth is 23 m.
text.References:
Bernardi, A. B., 1862. Description d'un cône nouveau. Journal de Conchyliologie 10: 404-405

Puillandre N., Duda T.F., Meyer C., Olivera B.M. & Bouchet P. (2015). One, four or 100 genera? A new classification of the cone snails. Journal of Molluscan Studies. 81: 1-23
